long_name: Total Runoff
comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

long_name: Surface Runoff
comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.

long_name: Evapotranspiration
comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

long_name: Total Soil Moisture Content
comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Frozen Soil Moisture Content
comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Temperature of Soil
comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Snow depth
comment: Grid cell mean depth of snowpack.

long_name: Snow Water Equivalent
comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell.

long_name: Annual Maximum Thaw Depth
comment: Calculated from daily thaw depths.

long_name: Water Evaporation from Soil
comment: Includes sublimation.

long_name: Transpiration
Cumulative Potential Net Irrigation Water Requirement
comment: Soil water demand required to avoid water stress accumulated across the growing season, excluding any water losses associated with application or transport and without constraints due to water availability; only needed for `firr` simulations.

long_name: Crop Yields
comment: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production. Yields are reported per growing seasons and not per year.

long_name: Cumulative Evapotranspiration
comment: Evapotranspiration = sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation aggregated across the growing season.

long_name: Cumulative Nitrogen Application
comment: Integral of the total nitrogen application rate over the growing season. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, the nitrogen application should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

long_name: Planting Date
comment: As Julian dates. The planting date reported here corresponds to the actual planting date in the simulation and may diverge from the planting calendar used for harmonization.

long_name: Planting Year
Anthesis Date
comment: Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of anthesis.

long_name: Maturity Date
comment: Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of maturity.

long_name: Harvest Year
comment: Usually the year when maturity is reached. Can also be computed from planting and maturuty day.

long_name: Total Above Ground Biomass Dry Matter Yields
comment: The whole plant biomass above ground.

long_name: Cumulative Nitrogen Uptake
comment: Nitrogen balance: Uptake (growing season sum)

long_name: Cumulative Nitrogen Inputs
comment: Nitrogen balance: Inputs (growing season sum)

long_name: Cumulative Nitrogen Losses
comment: Nitrogen balance: Losses (growing season sum)

long_name: Cumulative Nitrogen Leached
comment: Nitrogen balance: Leaching (growing season sum)

long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool
comment: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool
comment: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer
comment: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.

long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change
comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Leaves
Carbon Mass in Wood
comment: Including sapwood and hardwood.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Roots
comment: Including fine and coarse roots.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (plant) Respiration on Land
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO₂ Emission from Fire
Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

long_name: Root autotrophic respiration
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change
comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Grid averaged methane emissions from wetland
comment: Net upward flux of methane from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

long_name: Total Surface Carbon Mass Flux into CH4 emissions
comment: If possible, provide CH4 emissions for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Litter Respiration on Land in each layer
comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool
comment: {'forestry': 'As kg Nitrogen m-2 a-1', 'permafrost': 'Grid cell total'}

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool
comment: {'forestry': 'As kg Nitrogen m-2 a-1', 'permafrost': 'Grid cell total'}

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Soil
comment: {'forestry': 'As kg Nitrogen m-2 a-1', 'permafrost': 'Soil nitrogen excluding belowground litter if your model reports nlitterbg. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report nsoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil nitrogen for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil nitrogen integrated over the entire soil depth. If your model simulates different pools of different turnover times, nsoil separated by pools can additionally be provided. Please indicate them as fast, slow, and passive and describe your definition of the turnover times in your model description. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.'}

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation
comment: Grid cell total.

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass
comment: Grid cell total.

long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass
comment: Grid cell total.

long_name: Mineral Nitrogen in the soil
comment: Can be split into nMineralNH4, mineral ammonium in the soil and nMineralNO3 mineral nitrate in the soil. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Nitrogen in Products of Land Use Change
comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed nitrogen should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.

long_name: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (including NHx, N2O, N2) from fire
comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire.

long_name: Total nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

long_name: Total nitrogen loss due to leaching or runoff (sum of ammonium, nitrite and nitrate)
comment: Leaching means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil.

long_name: Total nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure)
comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area.

long_name: Nitrogen in deforested or harvested biomass as a result of anthropogenic land-use or change
Nitrogen mass flux out of land due to any human activity
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation to litter
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation directly to soil
Total nitrogen mass flux from litter to soil
Biological nitrogen fixation
comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

long_name: Total land NH3 flux
comment: Surface upward flux of ammonia (NH3) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

long_name: Total land N2O flux
comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

long_name: Dry and wet deposition of reactive nitrogen onto land
comment: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.

long_name: Net nitrogen release from soil and litter as the outcome of nitrogen immobilisation and gross mineralisation
comment: If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation
comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Leaf Area Index
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.

long_name: Plant Functional Type Grid Fraction
comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.

long_name: Evaporation from Canopy (interception)
comment: The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

long_name: Burnt Area Fraction
comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)

long_name: Surface Albedo of Land
comment: Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.

long_name: Soil Types
comment: Soil types or texture classes as used by your model. Please include a description of each type or class, especially if these are different from the standard HSWD and GSWP3 soil types. Please also include a description of the parameters and values associated with these soil types (parameter values could be submitted as spatial fields where appropriate).
